title: Computer Science Exit Exam â€“ Model 1

questions.question: Which of the following best describes an algorithm?
choices: A finite set of well-defined steps to solve a problem
questions.correctAnswer: A finite set of well-defined steps to solve a problem
questions.explanation: An algorithm is a finite, well-defined sequence of steps used to solve a problem.
questions.subject: Computer Programming

questions.question: Which OOP concept allows using the same method name with different implementations?
questions.explanation: Polymorphism allows methods to behave differently based on the object invoking them.
questions.subject: Object Oriented Programming

questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search in a sorted array?
questions.explanation: Binary search halves the search space each time, giving O(log n) complexity.
questions.subject: Data Structures and Algorithms

questions.question: Which data structure follows the FIFO principle?
questions.explanation: Queue follows First-In-First-Out (FIFO) order.
questions.subject: Data Structures and Algorithms

questions.question: Which algorithm design technique divides a problem into smaller subproblems?
questions.explanation: Divide and Conquer splits a problem into smaller subproblems and combines solutions.
questions.subject: Design and Analysis of Algorithms

questions.question: Which normal form removes partial dependency?
questions.explanation: Second Normal Form (2NF) removes partial dependency.
questions.subject: Database Systems

questions.question: Which SDLC model emphasizes risk analysis?
questions.explanation: The Spiral model focuses heavily on identifying and mitigating risks.
questions.subject: Software Engineering

questions.question: Which HTTP method is used to retrieve data from a server?
questions.explanation: GET is used to request data from a server.
questions.subject: Web Programming

questions.question: Which OS component is responsible for CPU scheduling?
questions.explanation: The process scheduler decides which process gets CPU time.
questions.subject: Operating System

questions.question: Which memory is volatile?
questions.explanation: RAM is volatile and loses data when power is off.
questions.subject: Computer Organization and Architecture

questions.question: Which protocol is used for reliable data transmission?
questions.explanation: TCP provides reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery.
questions.subject: Data Communication and Computer Networking

questions.question: Which attack involves overwhelming a system with traffic?
questions.explanation: Denial of Service attacks flood a system to make it unavailable.
questions.subject: Computer Security

questions.question: Which task is primarily performed by a system administrator?
questions.explanation: System administrators manage users, permissions, and system resources.
questions.subject: Network and System Administration

questions.question: Which AI technique uses heuristics to explore possible solutions?
questions.explanation: Search algorithms use heuristics to guide solution exploration.
questions.subject: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence

questions.question: Which language class is accepted by a finite automaton?
questions.explanation: Finite automata recognize regular languages.
questions.subject: Automata and Complexity Theory

questions.question: Which phase of a compiler checks syntax?
questions.explanation: Syntax analysis verifies grammatical structure using parsing.
questions.subject: Compiler Design

questions.question: Which scheduling algorithm may cause starvation?
questions.explanation: Priority scheduling can starve low-priority processes.
questions.subject: Operating System

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to remove a table?
questions.explanation: DROP removes the table structure and data permanently.
questions.subject: Database Systems

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Quick Sort has O(n log n) average-case complexity.
questions.subject: Data Structures and Algorithms

questions.question: Which software testing ensures individual units work correctly?
questions.explanation: Unit testing validates individual components in isolation.
questions.subject: Software Engineering
